thread.title: And the winners are: Here are your picks for top high school musicals
thread.title_full: And the winners are: Here are your picks for top high school musicals

author: Greg Adomaitis | For NJ.com
title: And the winners are: Here are your picks for top high school musicals
text:
comments 
Drum roll, please... 
Thousands of NJ.com readers sounded off during the past few days to determine which high school musicals we'll be attending in the coming weeks. The winners of our polls, which closed Friday, Feb. 24 at noon, are below. 
Keep an eye out during these productions for us and be sure to check NJ.com for photo galleries from these musicals. 
Camden County : Paul VI High School is presenting "The Secret Garden" on Feb. 24, 25 and March 3 and 4 at 7:30 p.m. A matinee performance is scheduled for Feb. 26. Tickets are $12 and $10 for students. 
Burlington County : Cinnaminson High School will present "Fiddler on the Roof" on March 17 and 18 at 8 p.m. with matinees on March 18 and 19 at 2 p.m. 
Mardi Gras 2017: Hot spots to hit in N.J. 
Salem County : Arthur P. Schalick High School will present "Sister Act, The Musical" March 2, 3 and 4 at 7 p.m. On March 4 is a 2 p.m. matinee. Tickets, in advance online, are $12 for adults and $10 for students and senior citizens. At the door tickets are $14 for adults and $12 for seniors and students. The performance will be in the Arthur P. Schalick High School Auditorium. 
Cumberland County : Millville Senior High School will present "Phantom of the Opera" from April 21 to 23 at 7 p.m. Tickets are $10. 
Gloucester County : Deptford Township High School will present "Young Frankenstein" on March 2, 3 and 4 with showtimes starting at 7:30 p.m. Tickets cost is $8 in advance and $10 at the doors. Greg Adomaitis may be reached at . Follow him on Twitter @GregAdomaitis . Find NJ.com on Facebook . Most Read
